byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Amy Chozick, Michael S. Schmidt, Jonathan Martin, Maggie Haberman and Mark Landler.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER and STEVE EDER

abstract: State Dept releases batch of emails from Hillary Rodham Clinton's tenure as secretary of state that cover range of everyday events and serious matters of state unrelated to terrorist attack in Benghazi, Libya; release is first of series, which was ordered by judge who rejected department's plan to release emails all at once after review.
lead_paragraph: Many of the messages concern simple logistics and scheduling, as well as matters like the war in Afghanistan and women’s issues.

headline.main: New Trove of Hillary Clinton’s Emails Highlights Workaday Tasks at the State Department
headline.print_headline: New Trove of Clinton’s Emails Highlights Workaday Tasks at the State Department

snippet: Many of the messages concern simple logistics and scheduling, as well as matters like the war in Afghanistan and women’s issues.
